Happening now: President John Dramani Mahama begins Independence Day address.
My heart was gladdened when I noticed the unanimity exhibited in the demonstration in support of equal citizenship.
We must celebrate and enhance our successes and recognise and minimize our failures.
Each and everyone of us, in our ethnic and cultural diversity, contributes in a unique way to make our nation great and strong.
Our diversity must be a source of strength, not a weakness. Our diversity should be harnessed for the realization of our national interest.
Government is not averse to the use of inter-faith channels and dialogue to resolve any disagreements amongst our different faith groups.
Our nation is celebrated for our strong democracy, respect for human rights, free expression, ethnic harmony and religious tolerance.
Ghana is an oasis of peace, democracy, religious and ethnic tranquility.
Multi-party democracy is not synonymous with enmity and division.
Belonging to different political organisations is no reason why we cannot work together to achieve solutions to our common challenges.
We cannot sacrifice our Ghanaian character of ethnic and religious harmony on the alter of political bigotry.

The advisory tweets now excerpts of the speech of the president during delivery of houses of #MinhaCasaMinhaVida in MG.
RT @TVNBR: NOW: President @dilmabr addresses the #MMMV #moradias delivery ceremony in Araguari (MG). Watch: http://t.co/p3mX3N...
We conquered the largest housing program in the history of our country and certainly one of the largest housing programs in the world. #MCMV
Homes delivered today have solar heating and families will have a lower light bill than they had before. #My home, my life
I know that when you think of numbers, they impress. Here in Araguari, we have delivered almost 4,500 houses. #My home, my life
This means that 1 in 5 araguarinos had access to #MinhaCasaMinhaVida
We are committed to hiring, by the end of 2018, another 3 million homes in #MinhaCasaMinhaVida
We will come very close to fully selecting the housing problem in some income brackets. #My home, my life
Since the beginning of the international crisis, we have been aiming to secure employment and salary, and we have succeeded.
As the world only unemployed and reduced wages, we had a reduction in unemployment and an increase in the income of Brazilians.
We are now entering a new phase of confrontation of the crisis, in which measures will be necessary for a new trajectory in order to grow.
We want to improve even more what we already have achieved. So we are making corrections and adjustments.
Our project is to continue generating employment, guaranteeing wages and programs such as #MinhaCasaMinhaVida and #Pronatec, for example.
Expanding the exhaust system is critical. Ngm sees the sewage, but the effects of when there is no see in the health of people.
We approve works of fundamental infrastructure that will change the situation of Araguari.
We are making an immense effort so that Brazil not only continues to make social programs, but also expand the investments (...)
(...) have a prosperous economy, continue to generate employment and income for the population.
When we have partners, it is easy to make programs. Here in MG, I greet the gov. Pimentel, q is committed to all achievements.
Try to ensure that the conquest of you becomes, in fact, a true path of hope and future. #My home, my life

Bulgaria-Azerbaijan relations are strategic partnership relations. These relations have very good prospects.
Azerbaijan already has a joint declaration on strategic partnership with seven EU member states.
This can be a good basis for any document that will be signed between the European Union and Azerbaijan in the future.
Azerbaijan plays an active role in the establishment of transport corridors in the region.
Azerbaijan's gas resources serve the well-being of the Azerbaijani people, as well as the energy security of European consumers
The approved gas reserves of Azerbaijan are 2.6 trillion cubic meters.
A broad diversified infrastructure allows us to increase our gas exports in any direction.
The Southern Gas Corridor is the largest infrastructure project in Europe today.
Our main desire is that Azerbaijan will transport its gas to the European Union in the maximum amount of time (cont) http://t.co/vlDV3CWcOp
Joint Declaration on Strategic Partnership signed between Azerbaijan and Bulgaria (cont) http://t.co/nFn4RDawqr
Today, in the Federal Government, we have launched a new model of excellence, all of which will be assessed based on their results and their ability to innovate and look ahead
The new model of excellence is the fourth generation of government excellence programs in the UAE since we launched the Dubai Quality Program 21 years ago.
A year later, we will celebrate the distinguished teams, the innovative bodies and the government leaders who are capable of looking into the future

"There are places and moments in America where this nation’s destiny has been decided ... Selma is such a place." —President Obama #MarchOn
"It was not a clash of armies, but a clash of wills; a contest to determine the true meaning of America." —President Obama #Selma50
"What enormous faith these men and women had—faith in God, but also faith in America." —President Obama #Selma50
"They proved that nonviolent change is possible. That love and hope can conquer hate." —President Obama #Selma50
"What could be more American than what happened in this place?" —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"What greater form of patriotism is there than the belief that America is not yet finished." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"That’s what this movement was all about—one leg in our long journey toward freedom." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"Young people can draw strength from this place, where the powerless could change the world’s greatest power." —President Obama #Selma50
"If Selma taught us anything, it’s that our work is never done." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"Selma teaches us, too, that action requires that we shed our cynicism." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"This is work for all Americans, and not just some. Not just whites. Not just blacks." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"With effort, we can roll back poverty and the roadblocks to opportunity." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"We can make sure every person willing to work has the dignity of a job, and a fair wage, and a real voice." —President Obama #Selma50
"We know America is what we make of it." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"We respect the past, but we don’t pine for the past. We don’t fear the future." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"What a glorious task we are given, to continually try to improve this great nation of ours." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
"We honor those who walked so we could run. We must run so our children soar." —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn
